comment._content: A different era, freight moved by river.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/64403351@N08] The Wyrallah was steamer built by Morts Dockyard and Engineering Co. in 1887. Some more info can be found here: trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13655725 -AG

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/64403351@N08] Thanks for your comment and links - That makes things very confusing. The Wyrallah built by Morts and Dockyard in 1887 sunk in 1924. Have a look at the image of the Wyrallah in this newspaper article from April 1924 reporting the sinking of the Wyrallah. It does look quite similar to the steamer in our image. See what you think: trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/429066 -AG

comment.author: 53120505@N02
comment._content: I live nearby, Wyrallah is a locality on the Richomond River, near Lismore. I know that doesn't help with identification of the ship though. :)

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: I think it is the second one.
